traits.description: It's not like pyromaniac, though. I like fire very much.
traits.name: likeflame

traits.description: Timmy tends to occasionally allow their mind to drift, even in the middle of working.
traits.name: absent-minded

traits.description: Timmy has a loose screw or two, a small trade off for being naturally scientifically inclined.
traits.name: eccentric

traits.description: Timmy strives for perfection in his work. They will naturally produce better quality products at the expense of time. However, making a low quality product will upset them. Additionally, they may very rarely quit a project mid attempt if they don't like the direction its going in.
traits.name: perfectionist

traits.description: While fully capable of warfare in theory, Timmy's fight or flight instincts heavily lean towards flight, and he will try to hide or run as a first priority.
traits.name: coward

traits.description: Timmy has a higher mental and physical fortitude compared to most and can more readily adapt to harsh environments in the rimworlds.
traits.name: brave

traits.description: Minor bruises and scrapes plague Timmy all too often, mostly due to uncoordinated tripping or falling.
traits.name: clumsy

traits.description: Timmy loves the brightness and heat of a dry summer day. They don't mind working up a sweat or sleeping in the warmth either.
traits.name: heatinclined

traits.description: Timmy loves the overcast and cold of a brisk winter night. They don't mind getting chilly or sleeping in the cold either.
traits.name: coldinclined

traits.description: A bomb could go off next to Timmy while they sleep and they'd continue to do so. They can't be bothered to defend the colony mid catnap, either.
traits.name: heavysleeper

traits.description: Timmy is naturally hygenic and organized. They will not track in dirt or throw trash anywhere, and feel happy while cleaning.
traits.name: neat

traits.description: Timmy is sloppy naturally and leaves trash and dirt everywhere it seems. At least they're not much bothered by messes.
traits.name: slob

traits.description: Timmy has problems taking breaks or resting mid job. he will continue to work even sacrificing their health or sleep.
traits.name: workaholic

traits.description: Timmy has never felt nausea in his life. Throwing up or food poisoning is foreign to him.
traits.name: ironstomach

traits.description: Timmy can't stand mistreatment of animals. he will feel happier being nuzzled or being a master to a bonded animal, but will be more deeply crushed when not master of a bonded animal or seeing one die. They also refuse to butcher.
traits.name: animallover

traits.description: Timmy believes deeply in human superiority. Killing animals will please them and the colony losing an animal is a cherry on top according to them.
traits.name: animalhater

traits.description: Whether because they're a bit chunky or because they shift their weight oddly, Timmy has broken a few chairs in their time and is likely to break more.
traits.name: big-boned

traits.description: Timmy only plays by their own rules, and will roll their eyes and take it easy while doing any task they've been forced to do.
traits.name: rebel

traits.description: Timmy needs clear instructions on how, and when to do certain things and will only work at a normal speed when being forced to do something.
traits.name: submissive

traits.description: Timmy is fueled by spite. They can't stand walking on the same soil as their rivals and will be elated by news of their life ending.
traits.name: vengeful

traits.description: Whether by past trauma or fear of change, Timmy rejects modernity. They may randomly punch or attack mechanical devices and refuse to learn or research anything about them. They also love killing mechanoids.
traits.name: technophobe

traits.description: Timmy always recalls the good times and lives to party, any party attended will be remembered for many times longer than most.
traits.name: fun-loving

traits.description: Timmy has hindered mental capacities. While slow to learn and hard to speak with, they tend to be much happier naturally.
traits.name: dunce

traits.description: Timmy learned a specific move in melee combat which allows them to disarm opponents and will use it frequently.
traits.name: martialartist

traits.description: Timmy believes they belong in high society, and loves nothing more than critiquing art and brushing elbows with royalty.
traits.name: snob

traits.description: Sour stomach plagues Timmy any time they're around too much blood or rotting corpses. Vomiting is just part of life for him.
traits.name: squeamish

traits.description: Timmy feels naturally anxious, but especially from social situations. They will not attend any gatherings and may occasionally need alone time in their room to breathe.
traits.name: anxious

traits.description: No amount of lovin' is enough lovin' for Timmy. he will tend to jump from partner to partner and tumble between the sheets with them frequently.
traits.name: insatiable

traits.description: Timmy refuses to give their body to anybody but their spouse and would never fathom initiating a divorce. They also hate being nude much more than other pawns.
traits.name: prude

traits.description: An armchair and flatscreen is all Timmy needs to be happy. Even reruns or ancient commercials are entertaining to them, they will never grow bored of television and tend to watch it more, as well as feel pleased after doing so.
traits.name: couchpotato

traits.description: Timmy is mad for all things feline. They will naturally gravitate towards bonding with cats, however they're not a fan of dogs.
traits.name: catperson

traits.description: Timmy is mad for all things canine. They will naturally gravitate towards bonding with dogs, however they're not a fan of cats.
traits.name: dogperson

traits.description: Timmy is a natural scientist. They research much faster and recall things better. However, they'll be upset without a laboratory dedicated to their work and tend to stress out more frequently.
traits.name: prodigy

traits.description: Timmy believes animals are integral to the way society and life functions from furry friends to sources of food. They love having as many as possible and are particularly good at taming and training them.
traits.name: menagerist

traits.description: The sea calls to Timmy. he feels happier just being near the ocean or a deep river.
traits.name: oceanlover

traits.description: The mountains call to Timmy. he feels happier just being near a large mountain.
traits.name: mountainlover

traits.description: Timmy has a twisted secret. he treats organ harvesting like a sick experiment, and does not even blink at the idea. While harvesting one will make them happy, going too long without giving in to their compulsion will upset them.
traits.name: madsurgeon

traits.description: Timmy is supposedly a hand-to-hand combat specialist, but only when inebriated. They claim to become more talented the more drunk they are.
traits.name: drunkenmaster

traits.description: Timmy is compulsive to steal and take things that don't belong to them, even if it means angering the other party.
traits.name: kleptomaniac

traits.description: Smokeleaf culture is just part of life for Timmy. he absolutely adores smokeleaf and would rather die before giving it up.
traits.name: stoner

traits.description: Alcohol culture is just part of life for Timmy. he absolutely adores booze and would rather die before giving it up.
traits.name: lush

traits.description: Timmy loves to travel and does so swiftly, but can grow upset if they haven't done so in a while. They are also quite adept at foraging while traveling.
traits.name: wanderlust

traits.description: Timmy is never really asleep or awake. he is almost zombie like, lurching along and working very slowly, and will only sleep once every three days or so.
traits.name: insomniac

traits.description: Timmy has grown tired of the world and needs to be constantly distracted to stop dark thoughts. his bleak personality is a big downer and therefore it is very hard to become friends with them.
traits.name: worldweary

traits.description: Timmy is hardened through what can only be presumed as old emotional trauma. They feel absolutely nothing from lost animals, colonists, family, prisoners or dead bodies.
traits.name: desensitized

traits.description: Only the finest of culinary creations may grace the lips of Timmy. They feel neutral towards mundane meals, but will laud and savour lavish meals down to the last bite.
traits.name: refinedpalate

traits.description: Whether through studying ancient manuscripts or years of scholastic pursuit Timmy is surprisingly well read on a variety of topics, particularly science and medical practice.
traits.name: academian

traits.description: Timmy strongly believes infrastucture rules all and is a natural born stoneworker.
traits.name: groundbreaker

traits.description: In the eyes of Timmy food is art, their culinary creations are incredibly beautiful, amazing to taste, and almost always safe to eat.
traits.name: gastronomist

traits.description: Flora and fauna are both vital to Timmy. They use all parts of plants and animals and strongly appreciate mother Gaia's blessings.
traits.name: ecologist

traits.description: Timmy has an eye for silver and a tongue made from it. They believe their products are the best products and he will likely convince you if given the chance.
traits.name: tycoon

traits.description: Timmy is strangely hypercoagulating and will bleed much more slowly than most.
traits.name: thickskinned

traits.description: Timmy is strangely hemophilic and tends to bleed much more profusely than others.
traits.name: thinskinned

traits.description: Timmy has trouble expressing themselves until its all too much to bear, whereafter they will have an utter meltdown.
traits.name: schizoid

traits.description: For some strange reason, Timmy is not touched by ancient mechanoids, they constantly ignore him no matter what Timmy takes against them.
traits.name: techno-ghost

traits.description: Beauty has a tendency to drive one mad. Should that beauty be devilish, it can even break one's dignity.
traits.name: witch

traits.description: Timmy is a Sylveon, and he is absolutely adorable, as expected from gene-engineered servitor. Sylveons were gene-engineered to be a productive workers at assembly line and basic principles of Crafting are embedded in their DNA.
traits.name: sylveon

traits.description: Timmyは観賞用に製造された。その完成された美しいフォルムは見たものを目を釘付けにする。
traits.name: 観賞用機体

races.description: A baseline human, mostly unmodified by gene engineering and mostly unchanged by evolutionary pressures on non-Earth planets.
races.name: human

races.description: It is a beautiful creature with human and dragon characteristics. It is mainly seen in the wild. Their silver-haired fur is hard and soft, making them expensive on the black market and often a target for hunters.
races.name: Dragonian

races.description:
Genetically modified giant sentient bee-ings. Originally created by humans as a terraforming bio-tool for the proliferation of angiosperms, these flightless bees are found on countless terraformed rimworlds.
 Apini are often wiped out by the point a planet reaches urbworld status. 
 They possess some mamalian DNA, such as complex lung structure. Apini will also happily intergrate themselves into human "hives" if they feel like they have purpose.
races.name: apini

races.description:
An azure offshoot of the Apini, Azuri are simple-minded ravenous insectoids with a swarm like structure. They propagate by laying their eggs in hapless Apini, eventually killing the host bee in the process.
Noone knows where the Azuri originated from, but it is well known how they spread across the rim. Many an urbworld (with a government based on a basic set of ethics) have reached a level of development where the primitive Apini are an obstruction. However removing them would be considered genocide of sapient beings. To circumvent ethical laws, some leaders will stealthily import live Azuri eggs. 
The Azuri are like wildfire; they will destroy all Apini hives they come across, hunting down any stragglers. Unfortunately, they do not prepare like Apini, often dying of starvation and cold (usually after they run out of to kill).

“No, that's the beautiful part. When wintertime rolls around, the Azuri simply freeze to death”
races.name: azuri

races.description: What happens if you want to terraform a planet that has very poor or even no soil? What if there are hostile flora and fauna? The Apini terraform and survive by planting and harvesting flowers. You would need to create a race that was better at fighting and able to use an alternate food source.A more hearty alternative for planets where the Apini can't survive long enough to terraform the planet.And so with a slight change to the Apini DNA, splicing in Vulture/Carrior bee genes, the Necropini were born. Stronger and more resistant than normal Apini, and with the ability to make “meat honey”;the Necropini (or Death Bees) were created to terraform worlds that normal Apini would not survive on.
races.name: necropini

races.description: A genetically engineered species of territorial canine-people. Bori possess dog-like ears and tails, but are otherwise entirely humanoid.
races.name: Bori

races.description: A genetically engineered species of sheep people. They produce milk and a beautiful yet strong wool called "aries", which can be used to create the material known as "orion". Most individuals are fragile and rely on protection from others.
races.name: sheepawn

races.description: Genetically modified species, believed to be either the original progenitor stock for their parent companies products or a hybrid of all the variants of that type. One of the most common Eeveelutions with the smallest body size. Eevee is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Eevee

races.description: Espeons were a highly experimental xenotype developed upon entropy manipulation research. First "experiments" were able to alter space and matter at small scale without any restrictions. After their modification as servitor species for Glitterworld, Espeons have lost most of their dangerous abilities. But they still should be approached carefully. Espeon is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Espeon

races.description: Flareon is a Genetically modified species designed to survive in environments with extreme heat. They are more robust than many others Eeveelutions and require a bit less nutrition thanks to their unique ability to partially convert thermal radiation into useful energy for their cells. Flareon is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Flareon

races.description: Glaceons were a highly experimental xenotype developed upon entropy manipulation research. Glaceons are able to reduce local enthropy and to seemingly dump it into nowhere. Glaceons themselves seem to have much lower enthropy than their surroundings, making them essentially immunte to cold temperatures. Glaceon is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Glaceon

races.description: Jolteons were originally developed for military purposes with manipulation of electricity as their primarly focus. After project was scrapped, Jolteons were quickly modified into agile, dexterous servitors for one of the rural glitterworlds. While most of their abilities were disabled, they are still able to utilize electricity to some extent. Jolteon is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Jolteon

races.description: Leafeon is a species, based at Eevee's genome, with photosynthesis capabilities and were originally designed for hot climates with scarcity of food. Leafeons require minimal amount of nutrition in conditions of Rimworld but if their leaves are damaged, it directly affects their productivity. Leafeon is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Leafeon

races.description: Umbreon is a species, based at Eevee's genome. Umbreon were originally designed to act as bodyguards, surveillance and other covert security roles for events and companies that valued aesthetics very highly. Umbreon, despite their small body size are very tough and hard to kill, not to mention fatal melee attacks that they can deal. Anyone who is not as tough as them or doesn't have corresponding equipment to counter their capabilities should avoid melee combat at all costs. Umbreon is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Umbreon

races.description: Genetically modified species, closely related to Sylveons. Their origin is barely known, but there's rumors that they come from a group of Sylveons that managed to escape from slavery at colony ship a few hundred years ago. Said ship crashed at aquatic world and survivors had to gene-engineer themselves with barely functioning genepods to survive. Despite its appearence, this species has strong physical strength and are easily able to win a brawl fight against average human. Vaporeons is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Vaporeon

races.description: Epona is a humanoid creature whose origin is completely unknown except that it has its origin in Glitterworld. Some scholars view Epona as a kind of chimera with insects, not a gene-binding race with horses. Whatever the truth is. Epona considers themselves a centaur. They have established their own kingdoms in the name of horses in Rimworlds on the periphery.
races.name: Epona

races.description: This is Epona, which has become huge due to a problem with the gene called Destrier Syndrome. Only women get Destrier syndrome and get stronger to match their size, but they become a little stupid.
races.name: Destrier

races.description:
They are bioweapons recreated after Mechanoids by the Anties.
\Tri-Jaws are possessed only the most advanced Hives and are stationed at the last lines of defense.

They are equipped with A powerful red burst laser weapon can be fired at up to 2 people, and can be fired at 1 person while moving.

If the Tri-Jaws are seen on the battlefront, it means child's play is over.
races.name: Anty Tri-Jaw

races.description:
They are bioweapons recreated after Mechanoids by the Anties.

Dreadnaughts are possessed only the most advanced Hives and are stationed at the last lines of defense.

They are equipped with low-angle intercepting systems. Unlike low-angle shields, they deny both incoming and outgoing projectiles.(Dlc) 

If the dreadnaughts are seen on the battlefront, it means child's play is over.
races.name: Anty Dreadnought

races.description:
They are bioweapons recreated after Mechanoids by the Anties.
\Hive guard are possessed only the most advanced Hives and are stationed at the last lines of defense.

They are equipped with High-angle intercepting systems. Unlike High-angle shields, they deny both incoming and outgoing projectiles.(Dlc) 

If the Hive guard are seen on the battlefront, it means child's play is over.
races.name: Anty Hive guard

races.description:
Anties are genetically engineered beings by a private company to replace dying soldiers on the battle field.

Everything has gone south when the company has let their guard down to celebrate their recent progress. Due to a mistake made by one of the employees, the Anties have been set free from the lab and ended up in space.

Their personalities are gentle by nature, but they were made to know only but war. On each planet they end up, they burn everything down to ash, using themselves as the main source of the fuel.

Anty is hermaphrodite, has no externally exposed reproductive organs, but has both a scrotum and ovaries in the abdomen.

Anty's gender is indicated based on her reproductive system, which was a little more developed prior to consuming the Nutritional jelly.

The average height of common anty ergates and queen ants is 140cm, while soldier ants are 170cm. Depending on needs or the type of hive, it can transform or grow up to 200cm.
races.name: Anty

races.description: A baseline human, mostly unmodified by gene engineering and mostly unchanged by evolutionary pressures on non-Earth planets.
races.name: human

races.description:
The heruan are a race of genetically modified xenohumans hailing from a remote glitterworld established during the First Wave of Exploration. Direct descendents of the people of Old Earth, the heruan people sent forth the Triune Expedition Fleets in the wake of the fall of Old Earth and the collapse of the Origin Systems, their mission to catalogue and preserve the breadth of humanity in order to keep their memories alive for posterity.

Heruan society is centered around the Triune castes of Sun, Moon, and Star. These are not hereditary castes but ones adopted in adulthood; heruan adolescents are expected to aspire to and train themselves for future inclusion into a caste.

Heruan are sleek and nimble with powerful legs. They are swift on foot and their powerful talons can be dangerous in a fight, but their relative frailty makes them poor combatants overall. Heruan are naturally inquisitive and eager to learn about unfamiliar people and cultures, preferring intellectual and creative pursuits over the prosecution of war. However, they understand that sometimes the only way to preserve the memory of others is to defend oneself against those who would destroy them.
races.name: heruan

races.description: Heyras settled in Rimworld a long time ago. They possess a unique psychic ability to, occasionally, hear whispers in their heads. Despite these whispers being mostly scattered words, Heyras believe they are the oracles of God. We do not know if these whispers are real. But it is confirmed that Heyras have a higher psychic sensitivity than humans.
races.name: Heyra

races.description: These savage barbarians are the nemesis of Heyras. They have thrown away the sense of moral and pursuit the primal pleasure. A series of evidence indicates that Rong is a separated branch of Heyra, although the Supreme Hierarch of Heyra denies this in all her strength.
races.name: Rong

races.description: It is a human like a rodent gene. Although the origin is unknown, it is a monarchy society based on agricultural society. There are more female objects than males, and it is difficult to distinguish the gender of the object when viewed from the outside.
races.name: Ratkin

races.description: It is a human like a rodent gene. Although the origin is unknown, it is a monarchy society based on agricultural society. There are more female objects than males, and it is difficult to distinguish the gender of the object when viewed from the outside.
races.name: Ratkin subject

races.description: A small, bipedal, Fox-like humanoid that has a natural affinity to fire and psychic capabilities. It's unknown what kind of gene-engineering magic the Glitterworld that originally produced them used, but their bodies have almost a complete resistance to fire and high temperatures. These creatures are able to consciously regulate temperature of their bodies. Before collapse of it's original solar system, this species was mainly used as domestic servants, entertainers, or just a beauteful and kind friend to have around. Braixen is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Braixen

races.description: A medium-sized, bipedal, Fox-like humanoid that has a natural affinity to fire and psychic capabilities. Related to Braixen and can be considered as a more "mature" version of it from standpoint of whoever originally designed them. It's unknown what kind of gene-engineering magic the Glitterworld that originally produced them used, but their bodies have almost a complete resistance to fire and high temperatures. These creatures are able to consciously regulate temperature of their bodies. Before collapse of it's original solar system, this species was mainly used as domestic servants, entertainers, or just a beauteful and kind friend to have around. Delphox is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Delphox

races.description: A medium-sized, bipedal, Fox-like humanoid that has a natural affinity to frost and psychic capabilities. Related to Delphox and Braxen, and is considered to be an alternative version designed long ago for a very cold glitterworld. It's unknown what kind of gene-engineering magic the Glitterworld that originally produced them used, but their bodies have almost a complete resistance to cold temperatures. These creatures are able to consciously regulate temperature of their bodies. Before collapse of it's original solar system, this species was mainly used as domestic servants, entertainers, or just a beauteful and kind friend to have around. Icephox is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Icephox

races.description: An all-female race of humans spliced with fox genes. Originally, they were Glitterworld designermates from the planet Aolara, but an internal war forced them to leave their homeworld. Now they are spread among the rim.
races.name: Kurin

races.description:
A humanoid race living in cities under the sea. Having traits similar to sea creatures, their blood contains substances that can be used for various medical uses.

Descendants of glitterworld explorers who settled in the deep sea, generations of body modifications has led to their current form. Spreading far and wide into the rim, they built many cities and prospered. Until now.
races.name: Moyo

races.description: A subspecies of the Moyo race, usually babies born after Moyo fertilized by creature infected with the Leviathan virus. And because the symbiotic virus affects, most of them have strange personalities, but not intrinsically bad.
races.name: Red Moyo

races.description:
Mincho is a slime-like race fully comprised of mintchoco ice cream.

ICEcRIM Co. created slime using mintchoco flavor ice cream with variant mechanite as an advertisement toy. However, due to an accidental mix-up during the final production stage, the wrong kind of variant, that was supposed to be disposed of due to critical defects, was used.

Mincho mimics human beings out of pure affection. They wish the humans to love them and "consume" them.

Due to the simplicity of body composition, they are capable of regenerating even severed heads, resilient against diseases, and endures most fatal wounds.

Differences in the nerve system made them also immune to pain and psychic waves.

However, Mincho is not capable of thinking, slow to learn and work, and weak against heat. 

When they are killed somehow (perhaps by having their core destroyed) they will turn into a lump of mintchoco ice cream.
races.name: mincho

races.description:
Marilyn was originally a tribal girl. One day, the parents were killed in a pirate attack, and Marilyn was sold to the Empire as a slave. The Empire, which discovered the qualities of psychic in Marilyn, sent her to the Institute of psychic.

The Empire wanted to control the Mincho - slime type creatures discovered in recent years - with psychic and use it as a weapon and a labor force. But the Mincho was numb to psychic in the first place, so there was no progress in research.

The institute hypothesized that if parasites the variant mechanites - which makes up the body of the Mincho - a human body that has qualities of psychic, it can control the variant mechanites in the body through psychic, and as a result, it will can directly or indirectly control the Mincho. The Institute of psychic installed a psychic amplifier that includes variant mechanites in Marilyn's brain for enlighten psychic, and parasite variant mechanites.

But at the time, Marilyn's mind was devastated by the murder of her parents, and when a test-modified psychic amplifier was installed there, Marilyn went completely insane. At the same time, the psychic exploded, releasing the variant mechanites indiscriminately, and the researchers exposed to it became the Mincho when the body was reconstructed by the variant mechanites.

Marilyn escaped from the Institute and disappeared for several years, and reappearing. Her mind was completely rebuilt by the modified psychic amplifier, and she believes that Mincho is what will lead her to salvation. Marilyn calls herself a "Minchowitch" and worships and serves the Mincho at the same time.
races.name: minchowitch

races.description: A race that lives on the ruins of an unknown civilization. Also called Far North or Yeti, they live in a small society over a wide radius.
races.name: Maru

races.description: Meowstics are a genetically engineered type of xenohuman created by an eccentric group of Glitterworld scientists. They are specifically coded to have moderately high psychic capabilities in order to allow them to passively read the surface emotions and intentions of those around them. However this level of genetic engineering renders them less physically capable and hardy than most other xenohumans. Meowstic is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Meowstic

races.description: It is a race where foxes took on the mystical powers of the transcendent world and took on human form. Their body has an elegans organ in which the strength of their superpowers is determined by the amount of sunlight interlocked with the mechanite in their body. Thanks to this organ, foxes revere the sun and energy.
races.name: Miho

races.description: The Marvelous gift of glitterworld bionics. A humanoid with cat ears and a tail.
races.name: Nyaron

races.description: This pawn is automaton designed by PnL Industry.
races.name: Paniel

races.description:
Rakkles are reptilian humanoids originally found on a remote planet in the Rim. After their discovery, human colonies rounded them up and genetically altered them to have near-human intelligence, but also decreased aggression and appearances better suited to human tastes. They were also modified to give birth to females more often than males, creating a biological need for species interbreeding.

The newly created Rakkle species were managed by a company known as The Cradle beyond the reaches of the galaxy, while wild Rakkle were hunted and killed to protect the company's interest. Future generations within the facilities were conditioned and raised as slaves and livestock.

 After a series of escapes and revolts on planet after planet, a coalition of freed Rakkle began colonies of their own, resisting capture and invasion to create a new world where Rakkle can live outside the yoke of slavery. Despite The Cradle's best efforts, these settlements continue to grow in size and number.
races.name: Rakkle

races.description: A bloodthirsty vulpine near-human.
races.name: Revia

races.description:
Shadow-bending humanoids talented in abstract theory - the chaoura. Their abilities derive from data gathered on super-entities discovered through the littluna.

Concepts beyond human understanding - like imaginary numbers and chaos - come naturally to chaoura. Of these, they have a particular affinity for the elusive truth behind shadow itself.

Chaoura have a marvelous utility organ that exploits phenomena manipulated by super-entities. This organ activates in darkness, bolstering its owner's abilities.

Most attacks can't affect a chaoura under the cover of darkness. They can also evade perception and teleport through imaginary space when in darkness. In nighttime engagements, chaoura thus present an unprecedented threat. 

Contact with hostile chaoura results in a phenomenon known as "abyssal inflammation." This causes outbreaks of painful boils that each weaken the body separately. 

The strengths of chaouran physiology don't come without costs, however. Any equipment with physical protection disrupts their ability to blend in with shadows. As such, they must rely on specialized weapons and apparel. Since the latter can't protect them, they're also vulnerable outside of darkness. 

Direct exposure to sunlight weakens chaoura by paralyzing their utility organs. As such, most chaoura exhibit sleep inversion.
races.name: chaoura

races.description:
Technologically-reproduced and -augmented humanoids - the idearn. Modern idearn are imperfect replicas of a mysterious extinct race in the artificia clade. Little historical record exists about the original idearn. Most is mere hearsay from their sister races, or deduced from scattered bits of their technology.

Idearn can tolerate extreme temperatures thanks to a technological recreation of idhalian incorporeality. Laches idearn could be considered a baseline model, as their capabilities are rather plain compared to their kin. Nonetheless, Laches idearn still outperform human beings in most tasks by a large margin.

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: idearn (Laches)

races.description:
Technologically-reproduced and -augmented humanoids - the idearn. Modern idearn are imperfect replicas of a mysterious race in the artificia clade. Little historical record exists about the original idearn. Most is mere hearsay from their sister races, or deduced from scattered bits of their technology.

Idearn can tolerate extreme temperatures thanks to a technological recreation of idhalian incorporeality. Charmides-A idearn specialize in melee combat. Compared to the Laches model, Charmides-A have more robust armor.

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: idearn (Charmides-A)

races.description:
Technologically-reproduced and -augmented humanoids - the idearn. Modern idearn are imperfect replicas of a mysterious extinct race in the artificia clade. Little historical record exists about the original idearn. Most is mere hearsay from their sister races, or deduced from scattered bits of their technology.

Idearn can tolerate extreme temperatures thanks to a technological recreation of idhalian incorporeality. Charmides-B idearn are melee specialists that rely on their agility in combat. Compared to the Laches model, Charmides-B are quicker and somewhat better armored.

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: idearn (Charmides-B)

races.description:
Technologically-reproduced and -augmented humanoids - the idearn. Modern idearn are imperfect replicas of a mysterious extinct race in the artificia clade. Little historical record exists about the original idearn. Most is mere hearsay from their sister races, or deduced from scattered bits of their technology.

Idearn can tolerate extreme temperatures thanks to a technological recreation of idhalian incorporeality. Menexenus-A idearn specialize in area-effect disruption, weakening nearby enemies using aerosolized mechanites. They're even capable of utilizing the so-called "Other Side" to some extent, halving incoming damage.

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: idearn (Menexenus-A)

races.description:
Technologically-reproduced and -augmented humanoids - the idearn. Modern idearn are imperfect replicas of a mysterious extinct race in the artificia clade. Little historical record exists about the original idearn. Most is mere hearsay from their sister races, or deduced from scattered bits of their technology.

Idearn can tolerate extreme temperatures thanks to a technological recreation of idhalian incorporeality. Menexenus-B idearn use their agile bodies to quickly close in on enemy ranks before covering the area in fire and EMP blasts. They're even capable of utilizing the so-called "Other Side" to some extent, halving incoming damage.

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: idearn (Menexenus-B)

races.description:
Technologically-reproduced and -augmented humanoids - the idearn. Modern idearn are imperfect replicas of a mysterious extinct race in the artificia clade. Little historical record exists about the original idearn. Most is mere hearsay from their sister races, or deduced from scattered bits of their technology.

Idearn can tolerate extreme temperatures thanks to a technological recreation of idhalian incorporeality. Theaetetus-A idearn are high-spec tactician models that incorporate certain design traits of the requeen. They can enhance the capabilities of nearby allies using aerosolized mechanites and summon large numbers of melee-capable subordinates. They're even capable of utilizing the so-called "Other Side" to outright avoid damage.

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: idearn (Theaetetus-A)

races.description:
Technologically-reproduced and -augmented humanoids - the idearn. Modern idearn are imperfect replicas of a mysterious extinct race in the artificia clade. Little historical record exists about the original idearn. Most is mere hearsay from their sister races, or deduced from scattered bits of their technology.

Idearn can tolerate extreme temperatures thanks to a technological recreation of idhalian incorporeality. Theaetetus-B idearn are elite models that incorporate certain design traits of the qualeela. They can disperse deadly mechanites that will lay waste to any enemies in their vicinity. They're even capable of utilizing the so-called "Other Side" to outright avoid most damage.

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: idearn (Theaetetus-B)

races.description:
Recreations of an ancient cataclysm in humanoid form - Idearn Critias, or just Critias. Long ago, the Critias drove artificia to the brink of extinction and destroyed their Creator. For this, they acquired the atrocious title of "Decisive Autonomous Genocider Critias."

Long ago, as the Creator's influence grew, adjacent spacer societies began to fear its technology. Using stolen Mysterion plans, they compiled the data of every existing race of artificia to produce the Critias. But their haphazard methods created erratic, uncontrollable beings. Intended as mere Creator deterrents, the Critias instead wreaked havoc across artifician space.

United as one by the mighty qualeela, the artificia eventually stopped the Critias' holocaust. Yet the course of the clade's history was forever altered by the scars of war. The disaster affected each race in the clade in a different way. Some, like the nearmare, developed a deep-seated resentment of mechanical beings. Others, like the silkiera, became fascinated by the Critias' raw power.

But the most notable changes were in the qualeela. They grew obsessed with preventing the Critias from ever being reborn. Their leadership grew more tyrannical and suppressive as this obsession progressed. Even today, the influence of the disaster remains obvious in their domineering foreign policies.

Yet the Critias accounted for the possibility of their own destruction. During their travels throughout the stars, they left fragments of themselves behind. Into other mechanical beings they implanted their cells. They spread falsified information and hid pieces of their technology wherever they could. Indeed, there was no "original race" of idearn. The legends were mere fabrications intended to delude Entelechy and entice the ambitious.

The allure of power and wisdom will always draw people into mysteries. Knowing this, the Critias predicted that curiosity itself could become their salvation. And they were right.

"Repose at an end, the interstellar cleansing begins anew."

Idearn must replace their Arche cartridges once per season. Failure to ingest one in time will cause an irreparable loss of function equal to death.
races.name: Idearn Critias

races.description:
Small humanoids with enhanced intelligence and remarkable summoning abilities - the littluna.

Littluna bring the same summoning principles used by the nearmare to their limit. As a result, they can summon so-called super-entities from the depths of space.

When wielding their abilities properly, a single littluna can destroy entire settlements. This earns them the title of "war-ender."

Though powerful summoners, littluna themselves are vulnerable to damage and disease. They thus depend on the support of others to thrive. A littluna's summoning abilities also take a long time to recharge. Thus, they aren't well suited to handling short-term emergencies or consecutive battles. 

Some societies treat littluna as weapons of war. Others choose to honor littlunan personhood where their Creator refused to. Ultimately, those who protect the littluna must also decide their fate.
races.name: littluna

races.description: An elite littluna subrace of unknown origin - the Littluna Ideasklavos. They resemble the "Priestess Caste Littluna Dunamis," the progenitor race of all littluna. It remains uncertain what causes a littluna to develop into an Ideasklavos. It's said that Littluna Dunamis could harness the power of higher beings. Littluna Ideasklavos are known to inherit this ability. Yet other than that, their kind remain curiously undocumented and seldom spotted. Only scattered and anecdotal reports persist about the Ideasklavos. "She went mad" or "she became a monster," say some. "We all spewed blood and collapsed," swear others. ───────────────────────────────────────── ORCINUS BRIGADE EXCLUSIVE EXTERMINATION PROTOCOL: LITTLUNA IDEASKLAVOS (1) Excluding decoy operations, never directly approach the target. (2) Prioritize rescue of any allies subjected to the target's influence. NOTE: Does not apply in enemy territory. (3) Prefer weaponry with a high rate of fire to powerful yet slow arms. (4) Prefer to engage the target on open ground to avoid severe collateral structure damage. (5) When possible, request the support of the brigade chief. (6) The target is no longer a littluna. Spare it only the mercy of death. ─────────────────────────────────────────
races.name: Littluna Ideasklavos

races.description:
A humanoid race, difficult to distinguish from ordinary human women on the surface. In reality, they are half-human, half-artificia that inherit strengths from both lineages. As a collective, many societies call them mixed-race nexaga, or simply nexaga.

Most children born to artificia-human pairings are of the mother's race. This appears to be by the design of the enigmatic artifician Creator. Yet, in rare cases where the father's genes are particularly dominant, nexaga are born. Records suggest that any child conceived by a nexaga will also be a nexaga, without exception. 

Nexaga have few of their artifician forbearers' most recognizable characteristics. No nexaga can undergo acclimation or summon allies in combat, for example. Still, their hybridization offers them some notable advantages. From their human blood they inherit versatility and immune strength. Conversely, their artifician blood confers specialized proficiencies without any associated weaknesses.
races.name: nexaga

races.description:
The more common, versatile variety of the angelic humanoids called qualeela. The qualeela-genus are mass-produced variants of their parent race, the Qualeela-Keter. Originally born from vast bioengineering plants, qualeela-genus exist to bolster the qualeelan population.

Compared to their predecessors, qualeela-genus are generalists. Their defensive capabilities are respectable, even boasting the total fire immunity of the Qualeela-Keter. At the same time, their labor potential is about on par with a human's. Yet the qualeela-genus lack Regalia, and thus cannot invoke the artifician Creator's power.
races.name: qualeela-genus

races.description:
The rare royal variant of the angelic humanoids called qualeela. Qualeela-Keter descend from qualeela directly engineered by the artifician Creator. They were made to inherit their fallen Creator's role as an all-powerful authority. On many worlds, they now serve to protect and unite artificia across the clade.

Qualeela-Keter enforce their reign with "Regalia" - reality-bending devices integrated into their bodies. Regalia permit their user to invoke the Creator's wrath at will. However, Regalia were still under development when the Creator fell. In their incomplete state, they can manifest only 50% of their intended potential.

Compared to humans, Qualeela-Keter are twice as resilient, immune to fire, and equal in physical strength. And though their Regalia are fearsome tools of war, they strain the qualeelan mind and body. This apparently renders them abysmal workers, sensitive to both pain and psychic phenomena.
races.name: Qualeela-Keter

races.description:
Selfless, mothlike humanoids - the saclean. The silkieran corporation Artifician Industries engineered the saclean based on the silkiera genome. Saclean have fragile bodies, and are mentally incapable of violent acts of any kind.

Created as a so-called "service species," the saclean act as sapient livestock. They naturally produce nutritious milk and a strong, weavable thread called silk filament. Saclean are generally milked every two days and their thread spooled every season.

Saclean are mentally hardened and placid by nature. They tolerate harsh working conditions well, and are even capable of blocking pain on reflex.
races.name: saclean

races.description:
Industrious humanoids sporting the ears and tails of mammalian beasts - the silkiera. Genome sequencing suggests that they are a mass-produced alteration of the nearmare. 

Engineered as factory workers, silkiera excel at common labor. Beyond that, their practical capabilities are generally inferior to a human's. Like domestic animals, docility and conciliation are part of the silkieran genome. Compared to humans, silkiera consume less food and live long lives in the absence of disease. Unfortunately, their substandard immune systems mean they rarely last to their elderly years.

Silkiera have long since spread beyond their creators' reach. Yet, their inclinations haven't changed much under the freedom of independence. Silkieran colonies on the rim usually have sophisticated production industries. Most often, they specialize in weapon and tool manufacturing.
races.name: silkiera

races.description:
Renowned products of an extensive breeding program - the Silkiera Quality. With a bounty of natural talent and adaptability, they excel at almost every kind of work. Yet like ordinary silkiera, they have no extraordinary powers compared to their sister races.

Silkiera Quality often work as the managers, supervisors and bosses of Artifician Industries. Always seeking to avoid potential loss for their company, they tend to stay out of the public eye.

The presence of a Silkiera Quality can be a great boon to a growing colony's workforce. Opportunities to recruit them shouldn't be wasted.
races.name: Silkiera Quality

races.description:
The strongest and cruelest of the silkiera - the "Original Sin Silkiera Vixenmalice." They are elite members of their race, notably more self-serving than their common kin. This allows them to function as the backbone of an otherwise docile race.

Silkiera Vixenmalice occupy the highest executive positions within Artifician Industries. Like puppetmasters, they command the public-facing leaders of the company from the shadows.

They are cunning and brutal, fighting with ferocious skill that defies all retribution. Their formidable traits have allowed Artifican Industries to thrive despite the odds.

Like all artificia, the Silkiera Vixenmalice were once loyal servants of their Creator. But with the latter's fall, no one remained to rein in the Vixenmalice. Thus, they conspired towards one end - the perpetual advancement of Artifician Industries. At every oppportunity, their cabals host ominous, frenzied feasts.

As elite members of their race, Silkiera Vixenmalice exhibit superior physical strength. Moreover, they're innately capable of a unique kind of sorcery. They tend to use curses and nullifying abilities to prolong their enemies' suffering.

Eccentric individuals aside, Vixenmalice are cruel and self-centered by nature. As such, mutual cooperation can be a difficult aim for them. In societies where they live among other races as equals, it's often a challenge to keep peace.
races.name: Silkiera Vixenmalice

races.description:
Amphibious, predatory humanoids with a lower body akin to a marine mammal's - the xenoorca. They are natural born warriors originally created as living bioweapons.

Xenoorca inherit the strong muscles and tough skin of certain Earth marine mammals. Their insulated bodies have a high metabolic rate, causing them to thrive in the cold but suffer in the heat. These factors combine to make the xenoorca a race of ravenous, active huntresses. Like their sister races, the xenoorca also suffer from weak immune systems.

Reflecting their intended purpose, xenoorca tend to be cunning and brutal. Most enjoy the thrill of a hunt and offer their quarry no mercy. Still, some usual or adaptive individuals can learn to live in mixed-race societies. Such communities come to discover a cheerful yet mischievous side of xenoorcan nature.
races.name: xenoorca

races.description:
An elite subspecies of xenoorca - the "Hades Magnate Xenoorca Hadalnoia." Their genome incorporates aspects of the Neclose Chaoura's own. Their special abilities pertain to the deep ocean. They also exhibit remarkable hand-to-hand combat prowess, enhanced by their vitality and regeneration.

After a great conflict, the Hadalnoia led the xenoorcan populace into a coup d'état against the artifician state. This, along with a grave charge of "priestess slaughter," led to their banishment. Even in exile, they perpetrated massacres across space. It's thought that the Orcinus Brigade trace their origins from these genocides.

Through the years, Hadalnoia have continued acting as commanders for the Orcinus Brigade. Sometimes they're even spotted on the battlefield, leading the charge against powerful settlements. For their cruelty, Hadalnoia are often called by the awe-inspiring title of "Abyssal Mistresses."

Contact with hostile Hadalnoia causes immobilization from the weight of the deep sea. As such, it's best to avoid one-on-one confrontations. If all else fails, focus on eliminating a Hadalnoia's subordinates to force a retreat. 

The Hadalnoia were once the Creator's personal guards, proud and content. It remains unknown why they've been reduced to mere bandits. Yet whispered rumors persist of their quiet, selective killing of littluna.
races.name: Xenoorca Hadalnoia

races.description:
Valkyries - an ancient race created to resist the mechanoids. Despite all the genetic changes, they are almost indistinguishable from humans in appearance, with the exception of the not rare presence of tails, horns, additional pairs of ears and other minor distinguishing features.<color=#a2c8ff>

According to the original idea, mutations were supposed to be a replacement for the degradation of organs and not be so obvious. However, with the change of generations, less "human" and more "alien" representatives of this race began to appear, some of which are only indirectly related to the valkyries.

One of the significant genetic deviations was the complete degeneration of the male half of this race, which is why this race consists entirely of girls and was called the valkyries. But despite this, the representatives of the valkyries race have full compatibility with non-genetically modified humans, thanks to which they have not become extinct.</color>

<color=#f5ffa2>Note:</color> Valkyries have a significant bonus to melee and survivability, which compensates for the inability to wear some armor.
races.name: valkyrie

races.description:
A rare subspecies of valkyrie that hybridizes with Gauranlen sprouts.

Usually mutations change Valkyries slightly, an additional tail, an eye, or unusual abilities. In the case of the gaurkyries, the mutation brought about significant changes in both body structure and brain structure, creating separate subspecies.<color=#f5ffa2>

Gaurkyries do not experience emotions, and the reproductive system has been modified so that they are able to "give birth" to small mammalian creatures - dryads. Dryads "born" by the gaurkyrie are different from the usual, although they have a direct relationship. They are something like a biomass that has no mind and is controlled directly by the gaurkyrie. The process of birth itself has nothing to do with how it occurs in mammals, since the biomass simply falls away from the gaurkyrie like shed skin. The mucus of the bomass itself accumulates on the body of the gaurkyrie along with sweat, or rather it is. The biomass covering the entire body of the gaurkyrie exists in synbiosis with her, protecting her from the effects of the external environment. The disadvantage is the flammability of biomass.</color>

Despite her size, the gaurkyrie is very heavy, which limits her mobility, however, despite the fact that she is slow, she can still deftly dodge blows.

Also on their heads, along with their hair, leaves grow like those of the Gauranlen tree, so leaves can fall from the gaurkyrie's head. Sometimes, instead of leaves of gauranlen, a seed may fall from it.

<color=#f5ffa2>Note:</color> Gaurkyries are very tenacious and strong, but this does not make them invincible, keep in mind that their movement speed is incomprehensibly low.
races.name: gaurkyrie

races.description:
Equipment: Living Form - small humanoid helpers. They are miniature copies of the valkyries, their bodies are subject to the same mutations and aberrations. They were created to simplify the life of the valkyries, helping to treat wounds, cooking and psychological assistance.<color=#a2adff>

ELFs are considered adults from the age of 6, and their height does not exceed 1 meter. They are incapable of reproduction and new ELFs are reared in "mechanical eggs". Their bodies are small and light, and they can also hover in the air, but only for a short period of time.</color>

<color=#f5ffa2>Note:</color> This race is very fragile, any damage can become lethal for them, but they have significant bonuses to psi abilities. Also ELFs can sleep while being held.
races.name: ELF

races.description:
Yuran is an Ain race with the appearance of a rabbit, and its origin is not known precisely.
As a minority race with a small population, there are genetic problems and males do not exist. It continues.
Centering on the Miko with special abilities that are passed on through blood lineage, they live in a small village-sized village and have faith in the large cherry tree in their hometown.
races.name: Yuran

races.description: Miko serves and manages the village as a kind of duty for Yuran belonging to a family of special lineage.
races.name: Yuran Miko

races.description:
She is Miko who is fluent in curses.
According to the record, she even overcame death.
races.name: Yuran BlackSnake

races.description: Zoroark is a race of adorable genetically engineered foxes with slightly enchanted mental capabilities and agility. Originally designed by conglomerate of megacorporations in their home system as an advertisment tool for products, and as entertainers for selected few. These creatures became highly popular among elites in all neighouring systems. This particular subspecies of Zoroark is black in color. Zoroark is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Zoroark

races.description: Zoroark is a race of adorable genetically engineered foxes with slightly enchanted mental capabilities and agility. Originally designed by conglomerate of megacorporations in their home system as an advertisment tool for products, and as entertainers for selected few. These creatures became highly popular among elites in all neighouring systems. This particular subspecies of Zoroark is white in color. Zoroark is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Zoroark

races.description: An alien species native to an Earth-like planet named Panastria. Their original creation myth says that they are made of stardust and fell onto Panastria, but their is no concrete evidence of this. After a failed uprising against the Empire, most are being relocated from their homeworld or imprisoned until further notice.
races.name: seren

races.description:
Spectral and incorporeal humanoids - the idhale. They are genetic siblings of the nearmare, apparently produced as a byproduct during the latter's creation. By nature, idhale tend to be pacifistic, sensitive and altruistic. However, they have difficulties viewing themselves as anything but potential slaves.

The idhale are effectively ghosts. Physical attacks pass straight through their bodies, and temperature extremes cannot affect them. Unfortunately, the idhale themselves find it difficult to intentionally touch any physical thing. They thus struggle to perform ordinary tasks, and have special difficulty wielding weapons.

In the age of the artifician Creator, the idhale were primarily relegated to sentry duty and common labor. Though the idhale have since spread throughout known space, they maintain a low population. Most now live as the property of slave traders, idly waiting for new masters.
races.name: idhale

races.description:
The artifician Creator's final elite race - the Idhale Avonruach. Even today, details about their kind remain shrouded in mystery. Records that exist revolve around a great war in the artificia clade's ancient past. The only tale widely known to the clade describes the Avonruach as "those who destroyed the 'Star-Crossing Bird.'" 

After the war, the Avonruach vanished without a trace. Given the lack of sightings, most concluded that they had gone extinct. Yet in recent years, they've started to appear again. They now organize regular assaults against powerful independent settlements. This continues even against the orders of the Entelechian Royal Bloods.

As the Creator's final creation, their abilities surpass even those of qualeelan royalty. They have the power to singehandedly defeat an army and even defy death. Upon perishing, they shortly resurrect even stronger than they were before.

Like their common kin, an Avonruach's body can nullify attacks. But in exchange for greater offensive performance, this ability is imperfect. It provides full protection against melee attacks, yet only partial protection for ranged attacks.


The Spirits of Iniquity did indeed destroy the Bird. But something was missing inside its corpse. 

On that day, they knew that the seeds of the next calamity had already been sown...
races.name: Idhale Avonruach

races.description:
The artifician Creator's final elite race - the Idhale Avonruach. Even today, details about their kind remain shrouded in mystery. races.description:
Horned, winged humanoids with enhanced intelligence and remarkable psychic capabilities - the nearmare. They were apparently engineered by an enigmatic entity simply known as the Creator.

Nearmare were designed as biological weapons of mass psychic disruption. Unfortunately, their abilities proved too dangerous and uncontrollable for weaponization. Human societies instead trained most nearmare as covert operations "intelligence specialists." This was a privileged position, guaranteeing abundant comforts and a high education. Thus, the nearmare had few qualms about working for humanity.

Eventually, internal conflict crumbled the societies that supported the nearmare. Survivors fled to smaller societies, using their psychic abilities to blend in. This, along with their unique reproduction cycles, allowed the nearmare to evade extinction.

Nearmare must carry psychic amplifier weapons to manifest their many psychic abilities. Among these is the power to summon ethereal entities to fight at their behest. They're also capable of voluntarily inflicting a variety of disruptive psychic ailments on their foes. However, a nearmare's physical capabilities are inferior to those of most other races. As such, they are at their strongest when cooperating with others.
races.name: nearmare

races.description:
Nearmare Devouts are variants of nearmare possessing enhanced capabilities. Nearmare become Devouts through intense training that leads to a series of transformations. Whether by prerequisite or as a result, all Devouts have profound faith in their enigmatic Creator.

Compared to ordinary nearmare, Devouts have much greater psychic sensitivity and endurance. Furthermore, they can summon resilient shades of past Devouts as allies in combat.
races.name: nearmare Devout

races.description:
The artifician Creator's finalization of the nearmare - the "Phantom Race Nearmare Aradia." Their development required data obtained from artificia created after the nearmare. So feared are the Nearmare Aradia's powers among artificia that their name alone is taboo. For this reason, they are sometimes instead called "coffin ones." 

Nearmare Aradia are no more resilient to damage than a human. Still, their psychic and summoning abilities far exceed those of their common cousins. They can even produce various types of targeted energy blasts at range.

Able to manipulate anomalous phenomena as if by magic, Nearmare Aradia are often compared to witches. It's said that in the Creator's age, they served as the dedicated leaders of all nearmare. In this unique position, they took their orders from the Creator alone. Thus, the Nearmare Aradia never recognized the authority of qualeelan royalty.

When the Creator fell, the Nearmare Aradia began wielding their powers freely. In time, this gave rise to terrible calamities across various worlds. The three major artifician factions thus came together to prevent further disasters. They debated possible plans of action, even considering total extermination. But in the end, they decided on mercy, sealing away the Nearmare Aradia in special coffins.

Nearmare Aradia removed from their coffins tend to behave as reasonable, intellectual people. Excelling in research and medicine, they often become well-respected members of their societies. Yet none can grasp their true nature, nor understand what lies in their hearts. Moreover, their devilish beauty will threaten to tear their peers' relationships apart.

Nearmare Aradia are capable of a terrifying summoning act termed the "Forbidden Summon." Be sure the vicinity is clear of friendly people and animals before using it.
races.name: Nearmare Aradia

races.description:
Draconic humanoids with extraordinary combat abilities - the solark. Ancient records state that the solark were made as the successors to the neclose and xenoorca, their sister races. Solark tend to live primitive, brutal lifestyles since their Creator's fall.

By some unthinkable means, the solark have an organ that acts as a small antimatter reactor. This organ, termed a furnace, allows its owner to create controlled antimatter explosions.

The solark were seemingly engineered with reference to the genomes of prehistoric Earth life forms, lending them large and powerful bodies. Solarkian scales provide strong natural armor, enough to stop many ordinary weapons outright. In raw strength as well, the solark outperform most other races with ease. On some worlds, solark are thought capable of toppling buildings in a single strike.

Unfortunately, solark must consume vast quantities of food to fuel their strong bodies. Moreover, their killer claws lack dexterity, reducing their capacity for skilled labor. This combined with their unique morphology also means they can't use weapons or tools of any kind. Lastly, solark regulate their furnaces based on ambient air temperature. As a result, sudden changes in temperature can be hazardous to them. Exposure to open flames in particular is to be avoided at all costs.
races.name: solark

races.description:
An elite line of solark - the "Dragon Queen Solark Halevh." Their design chases the ambitious goal of empowering the already formidable solark. Nonetheless, they were only completed long after the Creator's fall.

Solark Halevh have a humanoid form alongside draconic strength and control over antimatter. This permits them to wield weapons and perform most forms of work with relative ease. They also enjoy greater antimatter control, allowing them to flare more often.

The Creator intended the Solark Halevh as born leaders with strength to match. Nonetheless, improving on solark design proved to be a difficult feat. Their development required a long period of dormancy where solarkian traits could stabilize in a humanoid body. Though ultimately successful, this dormancy would continue well beyond the Creator's final days.

A Solark Halevh's greatest strength is its ability to assume a draconic combat form. This body, composed entirely of antimatter, tears through anything and everything without effort. Meanwhile, the user's true body remains suspended inside the antimatter dragon. This permits them to carry and fire weapons from within.

Beware - though powerful, Solark Halevh are ravenous eaters, even compared to their common kin!
races.name: Solark Halevh

races.description: Sylveon is a vulpine and lupine hybrid species engineered by maniacal owner of an industrial company in a now ravaged glitterworld to be a cheap working force at all kinds of company's facilities. Sylveon's adorable appearence has no practical purpose and was a purely aesthetic choice. All sylveons sport a telltale ribbonlike appendage set connected to their heads near a bowlike organ allowing them to move their ribbons with extreme precision and preform menial tasks easily while using their hands for specific and higher skill actions. Sylveons also boast a high intellectual ability yet have much weaker physical strength due to it being useless in high tech facilities and conditions of glitterworld. Sylveons are incredible crafters and even good researchers. But their bodies are incredibly weak and any injury of the bows dramatically reduces their productivity. Sylveon is an advanced variation of xenohumans with a precisely tuned genome that becomes highly unstable outside of very short range of acceptable parameters. Technically they even can be considered an alien species. Their modification is impossible outside of advanced Glitterworld facilities and without source Genome templates.
races.name: Sylveon

races.description:
エリノーマは突如宙域に出現した機械種族です。
どこで作られたのか、何の目的で作られたのか、そもそも誰が作ったのか、誰も知りません。
彼女らは効率を重視します。何に代えても。
races.name: エリノーマ
